pyatv_missing.title: pyatv Library Not Installed
pyatv_missing.description:
The pyatv library is required for automatic Apple TV discovery and pairing. Without it, you'll need to manually enter the device name.

To install pyatv, add it to your Home Assistant environment:
```
pip install pyatv
```

Click Submit to continue with manual configuration.

apple_tv_manual.title: Manual Apple TV Configuration
apple_tv_manual.description: Enter the name of your Apple TV device as it appears on your network.

data_description.apple_tv_device: The exact name of your Apple TV (e.g., 'Living Room Apple TV')

apple_tv_discover.title: Select Apple TV
apple_tv_discover.description: Found {device_count} Apple TV device(s) on your network. Select the device you want to use for handover.

pairing_disabled.title: Pairing Disabled
pairing_disabled.description:
Pairing is currently disabled on '{device}'. Please enable AirPlay in your Apple TV settings:

1. Go to Settings > AirPlay and HomeKit
2. Ensure AirPlay is turned On
3. Set 'Allow Access' to 'Anyone on the Same Network' or add a password

Click Submit to continue without pairing (handover may not work).

apple_tv_pair_pin.title: Enter PIN
apple_tv_pair_pin.description: A PIN code should now be displayed on your Apple TV '{device}'. Enter it below to complete pairing.

data_description.pin: The 4-digit PIN shown on your Apple TV screen

apple_tv_pair_pin_device.title: Enter PIN on Apple TV
apple_tv_pair_pin_device.description:
Please enter this PIN on your Apple TV '{device}':

**{pin}**

Once entered, click Submit to complete pairing.
